description: The Union home ministry has formed a second empowered committee in West Bengal to expedite citizenship applications under the CAA. This move comes as the volume of applications has surged, particularly from the Matua community. The new committee, headed by the deputy registrar general, aims to share the workload and reduce processing times for eligible immigrants.

This move aims to further boost digital toll collection, with cash transactions already reduced to a mere 1%. The transition is expected to enhance commuting ease by improving lane throughput and reducing congestion.

title: Relying on decades-old rulings, SC acquits stepdad of 6-yr-old's murder
description: A six-year-old girl's murder case saw her stepfather acquitted by the Supreme Court. The court found the evidence weak, citing a botched investigation. The stepfather was the last person seen with the child. His statement leading to the discovery of her remains was deemed inadmissible. The court highlighted the lack of corpus delicti and specified time of death.

title: Saudi crude imports narrow gap with Russia, set to become biggest supplier
description: Saudi Arabia has temporarily become India's top crude oil supplier, with imports reaching their highest since November 2019.  February saw nearly 1-1.1 million barrels per day arriving from the West Asian nation, surpassing Russia. This shift occurs amid US pressure on India to reduce Russian crude purchases, though analysts anticipate a short-term stabilization.

'US not at war with every nation': SC's sharp put down in ruling against Trump's illegal tariffs
description: The US Supreme Court has ruled against Donald Trump's global tariffs, stating the nation isn't at war with every country. The court found the administration relied solely on IEEPA, granting the President sweeping powers to impose unlimited tariffs on any product from any nation. This landmark judgment significantly curtails presidential trade authority.

Elon Musk projects a lifetime tax payment exceeding $500 billion, including…
description: Billionaire Elon Musk anticipates paying over $500 billion in taxes throughout his life, including death taxes. This projection follows a recent surge in his wealth, driven by a $1.25 trillion merger of SpaceX and xAI, which boosted his net worth significantly. Musk also humorously noted his status as the largest individual taxpayer, having already paid over $10 billion.

'Shocked': Only daughter of ex-Isro employee who killed wife, refuses to fly from US for funeral
description: A shocking incident unfolded in Bengaluru where a 70-year-old man killed his wife. He feared no one would care for her after his demise. The victim's daughter, residing in New Jersey, USA, refused to travel for legal procedures. An extended family member completed the formalities and performed the cremation.

description: India-Pakistan rivalry has intensified, with India skipping post-match handshakes, sparking debate. The move began in the Asia Cup and was linked to security-related sentiments. Former England players discussed the issue, with Phil Tufnell and Michael Vaughan saying India look dominant and Pakistan appear intimidated. Alastair Cook suggested the tension may be for public display and players might be friendly in private.

title: Trump's tariffs illegal: US top court strikes down tariffs imposed across globe
description: The ruling is widely seen as the big blow to Donald Trump’s second administration at the conservative-leaning Supreme Court. Just last year, the bench had consistently backed the president through a string of emergency decisions related to immigration, the removal of independent agency heads, and sweeping reductions in federal spending.

Alysa has often spoken about how important her family is to her life and career.

The biology of belief, optimism, and good health
description: It can be argued that optimism represents a biased view of reality. Why would evolution favour a trait that presents you with a bias instead of a perfectly objective view?

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman calls out tech companies for mass layoffs
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman criticizes companies for 'AI washing' – falsely blaming AI for layoffs driven by cost-cutting. While genuine job displacement by AI is coming, many firms use it as a narrative shield for over-hiring or restructuring. High-profile companies have even walked back AI-centric layoff claims, revealing more mundane reasons.

title: Anthropic exec answers why hiring engineers even if Claude Code writes most code
description: Anthropic's AI, Claude Code, now generates nearly all internal code, prompting questions about its 100+ open engineering roles. Executives clarify human engineers are crucial for prompting, customer interaction, and strategic decisions. This shift elevates engineers to focus on system design and product direction, with AI handling repetitive coding tasks.  The trend signifies a significant evolution in software development.
